title: Calories in a Bread Baguette
meta_description: Discover calories in bread baguette, including full nutrition breakdown per 100g and for a standard 250g loaf, plus carbs, protein, and variations.
assumptions: Standard white French baguette, baked with refined flour, approximately 250g total weight, no added toppings or fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, flour type, baking method, and size; homemade or store-bought may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 250g bread baguette contains ~722 kcal, primarily from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp butter spread per baguette

faqs.q: How many calories in one bread baguette?
faqs.a: About 722 kcal for a standard 250g white baguette.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a bread baguette?
faqs.a: Approximately 140 g total carbs for a 250g baguette, with 6.25 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is a baguette high in protein?
faqs.a: Moderate at 27.5 g protein per 250g baguette, mostly from flour.

faqs.q: How does baguette size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger baguettes (300g+) have more calories; scale from per 100g values (289 kcal).
Yes, whole grain or smaller portions reduce calories; avoid added fats or fillings.
